body:
```

    wheezy32:     writing manifest file 'pip-egg-info/Cython.egg-info/SOURCES.txt'
    wheezy32:     Unable to find pgen, not compiling formal grammar.
    wheezy32:     /usr/lib/python3.2/distutils/dist.py:257: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'python_requires'
    wheezy32:       warnings.warn(msg)
    wheezy32:     warning: manifest_maker: standard file '-c' not found
    wheezy32:     
    wheezy32:     Traceback (most recent call last):
    wheezy32:       File "<string>", line 20, in <module>

    wheezy32:         dist.run_commands()
    wheezy32:       File "/usr/lib/python3.2/distutils/dist.py", line 917, in run_commands
    wheezy32:         self.run_command(cmd)
    wheezy32:       File "/usr/lib/python3.2/distutils/dist.py", line 936, in run_command
    wheezy32:         cmd_obj.run()
    wheezy32:       File "<string>", line 15, in replacement_run
    wheezy32:       File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/setuptools/command/egg_info.py", line 254, in find_sources
    wheezy32:         mm.run()
    wheezy32:       File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/setuptools/command/egg_info.py", line 308, in run
    wheezy32:         self.add_defaults()
    wheezy32:       File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/setuptools/command/egg_info.py", line 332, in add_defaults
    wheezy32:         sdist.add_defaults(self)
    wheezy32:       File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/setuptools/command/sdist.py", line 191, in add_defaults
    wheezy32:         build_ext = self.get_finalized_command('build_ext')
    wheezy32:       File "/usr/lib/python3.2/distutils/cmd.py", line 299, in get_finalized_command
    wheezy32:         cmd_obj.ensure_finalized()
    wheezy32:       File "/usr/lib/python3.2/distutils/cmd.py", line 107, in ensure_finalized
```

```
vagrant@debian7-i386:~$ python3
Python 3.2.3 (default, Mar 25 2017, 10:08:27) 
[GCC 4.7.2] on linux2
```

comment_data.body:
Hmm, maybe this is related to pyenv not installing the desired Python 3.5.6.
I'll check that and reopen if the issue persists.
Yup, that was it. pyenv did not have 3.5.6 yet, thus it did not install 3.5.6 and used python 3.2.x it found on wheezy. It now works with 3.5.5 from pyenv. Sorry for the noise.

title: syntax error in build scripts of 0.28.5
